title: Minimal Carbon Emissions from Energy Fugitive Sources
description: In 2023, Ethiopia recorded a minimal carbon dioxide emission of 0.0001 Mt CO2e from fugitive energy sources, showcasing its low environmental footprint in this sector.

title: Low Urbanization in Major Cities
description: As of 2024, only 4.32% of Ethiopia's population resides in urban agglomerations with over 1 million people, indicating a predominantly rural demographic.

title: Extended Lead Time for Exports
description: In 2018, the median lead time to export goods from Ethiopia was 60 days, reflecting logistical challenges in international trade.

title: Limited Female Doctoral Education
description: By 2021, only 0.0065% of Ethiopian females aged 25+ had attained a doctoral or equivalent level of education, highlighting gender disparities in higher education.

title: Significant Investment in Tertiary Education
description: In 2015, Ethiopia allocated 47.85% of its education budget to tertiary education, emphasizing a strong commitment to higher education development.

title: Limited Access to Basic Sanitation
description: As of 2022, only 9.34% of Ethiopia's population had access to at least basic sanitation services, indicating a critical area for infrastructure improvement.

title: Low Male Employment as Employers
description: In 2023, only 0.15% of Ethiopian males were employers, suggesting limited entrepreneurial opportunities or business ownership among men.

title: Overall Low Employer Rate
description: By 2023, only 0.13% of the total Ethiopian workforce were employers, reflecting a low rate of business ownership across the population.

title: Incomplete Birth Registration
description: In 2016, only 2.7% of births in Ethiopia were officially registered, indicating significant gaps in civil registration systems.
